abstract.p: Prof Carole Joffe letter on Dec 23 article questions whether Sen John Ashcroft, abortion opponent, will continue as attorney general Atty Gen Janet Reno's efforts to protect abortion providers

It is hardly surprising that abortion-rights supporters are concerned about the selection of Senator John Ashcroft to be attorney general (front page, Dec. 23). One of the less discussed but crucial roles of an attorney general is responding to the violence of the antiabortion movement.

Attorney General Janet Reno distinguished herself from her Republican predecessors by the vigorous steps she took to protect abortion providers, including setting up a national task force on clinic violence. One hopes that at his confirmation hearings, Senator Ashcroft will be asked about his plans to continue the physical protections of those with whom he has such a longstanding ideological disagreement.
The writer is a sociology professor, University of California at Davis.
